title: BRAVE Day for Sophomores - November 14th
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: BRAVE Day at Talawanda High School is our annual family building and diversity event for our Sophomore class. The focus of the day is on making students realize that they are not alone at Talawanda, and they have many other peers and adults that care about and support them. Our students are a large part of our community, and by sharing stories, participating in activities, and most importantly - listening - they realize the important role they play with their classmates. Since 2009, BRAVE Day has been an influential part of our Anti-bullying, personal empowerment program at THS and our students come out of this experience better people for it.The event will take place…FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 14TH The effort that our students put into the day is an amazing thing to witness. Not only do students participate, they also encourage each other throughout the day on a level that is not normally seen in a typical High School. As a School District we appreciate their willingness to let go of their normal day and try to become a better person. Talawanda is thankful for them, and realizes that we have some of the most caring students around.If you feel your student would not benefit from the day, or would be negatively affected by the activities provided, they are not required to attend. We will not force students to participate, but rather want to provide the opportunity for them to improve as Talawanda students during BRAVE Day. They should stay in class during the event if they do not want to attend.

summary: **BRAVE Day** is Talawanda High School's annual family-building and diversity event for **sophomores**, focusing on anti-bullying, personal empowerment, and helping students realize they're supported by peers and adults. The event takes place **Friday, November 14th** and has been part of THS programming since 2009. Students are encouraged but not required to participate—those who choose not to attend should stay in their regular classes.

title: FCCLA Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: FCCLA is honored and excited to once again host the Veteran’s Day breakfast and assembly. If you are a Veteran, please RSVP at this link and join us on November 11th!

summary: FCCLA is hosting the **Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly** on **Tuesday, November 11, 2025** at Talawanda High School. Breakfast begins at **7:30 AM** and the assembly at **9:00 AM**. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. To RSVP, scan the QR code or email Mrs. Croucher at croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch, and total number attending. RSVP is approved for contribution. Event location: **5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, Ohio 45056**. Sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS.

title: PUSH Program Home Repair Grants Available
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
PUSH Program
PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 for more information. Application is attached. Http://www.push-oxford.org/

summary: **PUSH Program** provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, contact Jeanne or Sabrina at **513-523-8100**. Visit [http://www.push-oxford.org/](http://www.push-oxford.org/) or see the attached application.

summary:
The Talawanda School District provides several food resources for families in need:
- **Little Free Pantries** available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or as needed
- **Backpack Program** at all elementary buildings - small food bags distributed Thursdays/Fridays (contact building Social Worker)
- **Emergency Food boxes** available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours

Additional resources include a **calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule**, a **list of all Butler County food pantries**, and current **SNAP information**.

For assistance, contact your building's Social Worker: Kramer (Chelsea Pike, 513-273-3511), Marshall (Chrissy Rolfes, 513-273-3611), Bogan (Emily White, 513-273-3403), TMS (Lydia Schrag, 513-273-3311), or THS (Chris Robertson, 513-273-3224).

title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education
summary:
**Individual Testing (12/3-12/5):** For students who need to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking that class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

**Class Testing (12/16-12/19):** Only for students currently taking an Algebra C or Government class; tests will be administered during exam week. Make-up testing available 1/7-1/8.

Emails will be sent to students and parents/guardians before Thanksgiving Break with specific test requirements and details. Questions should be directed to **Mrs. Hess at hessb@talawanda.org**.

title: FCCLA Blood Drive - Save Lives
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education
summary:
**FCCLA is hosting a blood drive on November 7, 2025** from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at the Talawanda IN Auxiliary Gym. Individuals aged 16 and up can donate blood to help address the American blood shortage and support those in need of blood for illnesses, transplants, and other medical needs. The event is TSD approved for distribution. Healthy individuals aged 16-65 can donate, and participants will receive **free snacks and 1 hour of rest**. 

For more information: **+513-273-3200** or **CROUCHERK@TALAWANDA.ORG**
